item.title: Number 8 bins blocking pavement, 11th October
item.description:
Number 8 blocking pavement to prams and wheelchairs by leaving bins out all the time. No other house does this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Woodland Terrace, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover making constant noise, 11th October
item.description:
This manhole cover was fixed a matter of weeks ago and is already making a clanking noise every time a vehicle drives over it. This has been a persistent problem for several years now, can it not just be fixed properly?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Warwick Avenue, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime tree on boundary of sports ground, Opp 63 Court Farm Road. Appears to be regrowth from old stump. Suggest select main stem and remove other growth to leave a single stem tree. Remove adjacnt dead sapling, which has been dead for many years., 11th October
item.description:
Opp 63 Court Farm Road, on boundary of playing fields. Lime tree prune to leave one main stem to form new single stem tree. Remove dead adjacent sapling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Farm Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible abandoned vehicle registration NX16 UPM, 11th October
item.description:
Vehicle has not moved for over 6 months Appears to be abandoned
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 140, Welling Way, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fishing line caught and hanging from tree, 11th October
item.description:
Just to the left of this fishing stand there is fishing line caught in the tree. There is a bit of shrub hanging on the end of it so makes it easier to see. Please arrange for it to be removed to prevent wildlife getting caught up in it. A heron sadly died here recently suffering this fate. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hotspur Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Granville Road NW6 5AR and outside Hodge House NW6, 11th October
item.description:
Bag Spilled out Litter everywhere and Plants pulled out need Sweeping away. Also outside hodge house and area where Kilburn Park Medical Centre is Litter bins need emptying and area needs sweeping. This flexible cleaning is NOT SUITABLE. Why have the estate cleaners are street cleaners been cut? More flats are being built which means MORE RUBBISH and LITTER. It is A MAJOR PROBLEM on Granville Road and the Surrounding area it’s RIDICULOUS you have to take pictures and send them to the council and then someone comes. It should be done every week, not when A Resident Reports it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
